SEARCH
Module com.example.platformerplain
Package com.platformer.escape_beyond.model.game

Class GameState

java.lang.Object
com.platformer.escape_beyond.model.game.GameState
public class GameState extends Object
Represents the state of the game, including character selection, map details, and in-game variables such as time and collected supplies.

This class follows the Factory Design Pattern to manage the creation of characters and maps dynamically.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameState

      public GameState()
      Constructs a new GameState with default values.

      The default character and map are initialized, and all in-game variables are set to their starting states.

  • Method Details

    • setCharacter

      public void setCharacter(Character character)
      Sets the character for the game state.
      Parameters:
      character - The Character object to be set as the current character.

    • setCharacter

      public void setCharacter(int index)
      Sets the character for the game state by index.

      Updates the character's index and name based on the provided index.

      Parameters:
      index - The index of the character to be set (1-4).

    • setMap

      public void setMap(Map map)
      Sets the map for the game state.
      Parameters:
      map - The Map object to be set as the current map.

    • setMap

      public void setMap(int index)
      Sets the map for the game state by index.

      Updates the map's index and name based on the provided index.

      Parameters:
      index - The index of the map to be set (1-2 now).

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the game state by resetting all variables to their default values.

      This method initializes a new Character and Map, and resets all game-related variables such as collected supplies and time.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets in-game variables like time spent and collected supplies without altering the character or map selection.
